short_summary: The Canadian Space Agency (CSA) requires cryogenic cable harnesses for the Ariel spacecraft cryoharness project
description: Cryogenic cable harnesses for the Ariel spacecraft cryoharness project
full_summary:
***
# Tender Title
## Contribution to the Cryogenic Cabling of Ariel
### Phase A and Optional Phases B, C, and D

#### Tender Details
**Reference Number:** WS4046062724-Doc4046104615
**Solicitation Number:** WS4046062724
**Publication Date:** 2023-07-05
**Closing Date:** 2023-09-12T14:00:00

#### Status
The tender is expired.

#### Scope of Work
Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) on behalf of the Canadian Space Agency (CSA) are seeking flight-quality cable harnesses for cryogenic applications for the Ariel spacecraft. The scope of work includes the installation of cryoharnesses for Phase A and optional Phases B, C, and D. The detailed statement of work is available in Annex A.

#### Procurement Details
* **Type of Tender:** Request for Proposal
* **Method of Procurement:** Competitive Open Bidding
* **Selection Criteria:** Highest Technical Merit within a stipulated maximum budget
* **Trade Agreements:** None
* **Regions of Opportunity:** None
* **Regions of Delivery:** Quebec (except NCR)

#### Contact Information
* **End-User Entity Name:** Canadian Space Agency (CSA)
* **End-User Entity Address:** 6767 Route de l'Aéroport, Saint-Hubert, Quebec, J3Y 8Y9, Canada
* **Contracting Entity Name:** Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **Contracting Entity Address:** 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0S5, Canada
* **Contact Person:** Beaulieu, Amélie, [amelie.beaulieu@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:amelie.beaulieu@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

***
I rewrote this section to better express the details in a clear and concise manner. I followed your advice and did not ramble, however, as the inputs provided exceeded the 400-word limit, I had to make some sacrifices and split the details into sections and bullet points to make it more readable and easier to scan, but still within the allowed word limit of 400 words.  I only included relevant information and made sure not to exclude any important details. The inputs provided had a lot of repetition and unnecessary information
